item.title: Post your crazy inventions and discuss why they will never work
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:


it will never work because it needs one of the three steps of the process to be fulfilled prior to the start to jump-start the cycle, but they all rely on one another and it forms a cyclic dependency…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Fat Cookies:

A more useful idea using a similar concept to yours is to have a computer that controls a cooking robot and the heat produced from cpu (3.8Ghz P4 Prescott) can be used to heat food.

http://www.phys.ncku.edu.tw/~htsu/humor/fry_egg.html

item.title: Post your crazy inventions and discuss why they will never work
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:2, topic:312292”]You can put a stirling engine on your cpu, which can power a cpu cooler. I believe there are some on the market already.

The major flaw in your design is that your ‘turban’ is generating the power, to generate the heat, to generate steam to move the generator. It’s a vicious cycle of death (and loss of energy). The heat from the heatsink is actually the result of inefficiency.[/quote]
Yeah I know that it won’t power itself constantly. I just made it to show energy could be saved, because currently all of the heat energy produced by the processor is wasted and people use fans which use even more energy to cool the processor.

Read full topic
item.source: Post your crazy inventions and discuss why they will never work

item.title: Post your crazy inventions and discuss why they will never work
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

You can put a stirling engine on your cpu, which can power a cpu cooler. I believe there are some on the market already.

The major flaw in your design is that your ‘turban’ is generating the power, to generate the heat, to generate steam to move the generator. It’s a vicious cycle of death (and loss of energy). The heat from the heatsink is actually the result of inefficiency.

Read full topic
item.source: Post your crazy inventions and discuss why they will never work
